benchmark_details.name: Chichewa SMS Fraud Detection Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces a dataset for SMS fraud detection in Chichewa, including experiments with machine learning algorithms to classify SMS messages as fraud or non-fraud.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To construct a dataset of SMSs in Chichewa for understanding SMS-enabled fraud and to build and test classification algorithms.

data.source: Collected through crowdsourcing from the Malawi University of Business and Applied Sciences and local telecommunication companies.
data.annotation: Labels provided by contributors indicating whether SMS is fraudulent or normal.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated using predictions from classification algorithms on the datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Accuracy reflects the correct classification of SMS messages, while precision and recall indicate the rates of false positives and false negatives.
methodology.baseline_results: Best model (Random Forest) achieved 98% accuracy on the Chichewa dataset.
methodology.validation: Models validated through a 80:20 training-test split.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants provided non-personal, non-sensitive SMS messages.
